ayat.ayahEn: The Inevitable Hour!
What is the Inevitable Hour?
And what will make you realize what the Inevitable Hour is?
˹Both˺ Thamûd and ’Ȃd denied the Striking Disaster.
As for Thamûd, they were destroyed by an overwhelming blast.

ayat.ayahArV1: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
ayat.ayahArV2: واما عاد فاهلكوا بريح صرصر عاتية
ayat.ayahEn: And as for ’Ȃd, they were destroyed by a furious, bitter wind

ayat.ayahArV1: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
ayat.ayahArV2: سخرها عليهم سبع ليال وثمانية ايام حسوما فترى القوم فيها صرعى كانهم اعجاز نخل خاوية
ayat.ayahEn: which Allah unleashed on them non-stop for seven nights and eight days, so that you would have seen its people lying dead like trunks of uprooted palm trees.
Do you see any of them left alive?

ayat.ayahArV1: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
ayat.ayahArV2: وجاء فرعون ومن قبله والمؤتفكات بالخاطئة
ayat.ayahEn: Also, Pharaoh and those before him, and ˹the people of˺ the overturned cities ˹of Lot˺ indulged in sin

ayat.ayahArV1: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
ayat.ayahArV2: فعصوا رسول ربهم فاخذهم اخذة رابية
ayat.ayahEn: each disobeying their Lord’s messenger, so He seized them with a crushing grip.

ayat.ayahArV1: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
ayat.ayahArV2: انا لما طغى الماء حملناكم في الجارية
ayat.ayahEn: Indeed, when the floodwater had overflowed, We carried you in the floating Ark ˹with Noah˺

ayat.ayahArV1: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
ayat.ayahArV2: لنجعلها لكم تذكرة وتعيها اذن واعية
ayat.ayahEn: so that We may make this a reminder to you, and that attentive ears may grasp it.

ayat.ayahArV1: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
ayat.ayahArV2: فاذا نفخ في الصور نفخة واحدة
ayat.ayahEn: At last, when the Trumpet will be blown with one blast

ayat.ayahArV1: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
ayat.ayahArV2: وحملت الارض والجبال فدكتا دكة واحدة
ayat.ayahEn: and the earth and mountains will be lifted up and crushed with one blow
on that Day the Inevitable Event will have come to pass.
The sky will then be so torn that it will be frail

ayat.ayahArV1: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌ
ayat.ayahArV2: والملك على ارجائها ويحمل عرش ربك فوقهم يومئذ ثمانية
ayat.ayahEn: with the angels on its sides. On that Day eight ˹mighty angels˺ will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.

ayat.ayahArV1: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
ayat.ayahArV2: يومئذ تعرضون لا تخفى منكم خافية
ayat.ayahEn: You will then be presented ˹before Him for judgment˺, and none of your secrets will stay hidden.

ayat.ayahArV1: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
ayat.ayahArV2: فاما من اوتي كتابه بيمينه فيقول هاؤم اقرءوا كتابيه
ayat.ayahEn: As for those given their records in their right hand, they will cry ˹happily˺, “Here ˹everyone˺! Read my record!
I surely knew I would face my reckoning.”
They will be in a life of bliss
in an elevated Garden
whose fruit will hang within reach.

ayat.ayahArV1: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
ayat.ayahArV2: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما اسلفتم في الايام الخالية
ayat.ayahEn: ˹They will be told,˺ “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did in the days gone by.”

ayat.ayahArV1: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
ayat.ayahArV2: واما من اوتي كتابه بشماله فيقول يا ليتني لم اوت كتابيه
ayat.ayahEn: And as for those given their record in their left hand, they will cry ˹bitterly˺, “I wish I had not been given my record
nor known anything of my reckoning!
I wish death was the end!
My wealth has not benefited me!
My authority has been stripped from me.”
˹It will be said,˺ “Seize and shackle them
then burn them in Hell

ayat.ayahArV1: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
ayat.ayahArV2: ثم في سلسلة ذرعها سبعون ذراعا فاسلكوه
ayat.ayahEn: then tie them up with chains seventy arms long.

ayat.ayahArV1: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayat.ayahArV2: انه كان لا يؤمن بالله العظيم
ayat.ayahEn: For they never had faith in Allah, the Greatest
nor encouraged the feeding of the poor.
So this Day they will have no close friend here
nor any food except ˹oozing˺ pus
which none will eat except the evildoers.”
Now, I do swear by whatever you see
and whatever you cannot see!
Indeed, this ˹Quran˺ is the recitation of a noble Messenger.

ayat.ayahArV1: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: وما هو بقول شاعر قليلا ما تؤمنون
ayat.ayahEn: It is not the prose of a poet ˹as you claim˺, ˹yet˺ you hardly have any faith.

ayat.ayahArV1: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: ولا بقول كاهن قليلا ما تذكرون
ayat.ayahEn: Nor is it the mumbling of a fortune-teller, ˹yet˺ you are hardly mindful.
˹It is˺ a revelation from the Lord of all worlds.
Had the Messenger made up something in Our Name
We would have certainly seized him by his right hand
then severed his aorta

ayat.ayahArV1: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ
ayat.ayahArV2: فما منكم من احد عنه حاجزين
ayat.ayahEn: and none of you could have shielded him ˹from Us˺!
Indeed, this ˹Quran˺ is a reminder to those mindful ˹of Allah˺.
And We certainly know that some of you will persist in denial
and it will surely be a source of regret for the disbelievers.
And indeed, this ˹Quran˺ is the absolute truth.
So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Greatest.
